result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd Joseph Brazeau

records.addlTxt:
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Todd Joseph Brazeau in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Todd Joseph Brazeau.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for an order to show cause hearing.  Defense requests a date for plea and sentencing.  No objection from the State.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
records.descr: Adjourned order to show cause hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Todd Joseph Brazeau in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Todd Joseph Brazeau.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Todd Joseph Brazeau in court in person.  Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Findling is in trial; unable to appear for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Todd Joseph Brazeau in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Todd Joseph Brazeau in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Todd Joseph Brazeau appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
